Bio.title: Welcome to Chris Huber-Lantz' portfolio
paragraphs: I am a web developer with over 5 years experience with HTML, CSS and Javascript. For the past 4 years I have worked as a developer at Readz, a web publishing platform for designing and editing websites. While working at Readz I've done both front and back-end development on a stack comprised of Python/Django, MySQL, jQuery and a custom javascript templating system. In 2012 I graduated with a B.S. in Computer Science and Information Technology from California State Monterey Bay.

I have worked with a number of front-end, back-end and database systems. I have experience working with MySQL databases using raw SQL as well as ORMs. Additionally, I have experience with NoSQL databases (Amazon DynamoDB, Redis). I have worked on web applications in several back-end languages such as Perl, PHP and most recently Python/Django. I have 5 years experience working with javascript, jQuery and am currently learning React.

I am familiar with configuring and administering common web services such as Apache, Nginx and MySQL. I have experience building virtual servers using Xen, in addition to being familiar with other virtualization technologies such as VMware and VirtualBox.

Projects.title: Six Degrees
Projects.one_liner: A tweet crawler for identifying conversation topics.
Projects.desc: This is a project I developed while working at Readz. It includes a crawler that performed topic identification and engagement analysis on a user's tweets in order to determine which topics they discussed most, and with whom. It also includes a web-based dashboard that displayed results.

Projects.title: Nerve
Projects.one_liner: A platform for network analysis and intrusion prevention.
Projects.desc: Nerve was my capstone project at CSUMB. The goal was to create a functional network-based intrusion prevention system capable of being managed by a web-interface. This project involved integrating several open source projects, creating a web-interface, database and back-end daemon to manage them.

Projects.title: Servers on Demand
Projects.one_liner: A web based management system for the rapid creation of virtual machines.
Projects.desc: Servers on Demand was a project for a class in virtualization at CSUMB. In this project I created a web-interface to act as a front-end to a back-end Perl script created to manage the configuration and booting of Xen based virtual machines. Using the web interface, a user is able to configure/clone and boot a new virtual machine. Once the new virtual machine boots, the Perl script executes configuration commands via SSH and returns a link to the virtual server's apache server.

Projects.title: CDR Spy
Projects.one_liner: A call data record analyzer for Asterisk Voice Over IP phone systems.
Projects.desc: This project consisted of building a collector daemon to catch call events from Asterisk and inject them into a MySQL database. The next step was to build a parser script which used custom logic to relate these disparate events into call records which could be analyzed. The last component was a web application which analyzed call information in the database and produced dynamic reports.

Projects.title: Automated HTTP Monitoring
Projects.desc: This project involved creating a Perl script which periodically crawled websites in order to build a complete list of links for a particular website. Additionally I wrote a Nagios plugin which polled each page to ensure 100% of the site was available. This project also included functionality to automatically generate monitoring configurations when new sites were detected on the production webserver.
